summary: Valeriy Vladimirovich Kostikov was a Soviet employee stationed in Mexico City. Documents suggest he was involved in handling Lee Harvey Oswald's visa request and was suspected of having connections to Central American communist parties. He is mentioned in a file index from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Documents related to Kostikov include intercepts, messages, and a dispatch related to his activities and contacts in Mexico City.
significance: Kostikov's significance in the JFK context lies in his alleged involvement with Lee Harvey Oswald's visa application while stationed in Mexico City and his suspected ties to communist groups. This has led to speculation about potential Soviet involvement in the assassination.
